name: FConstraintInstance
doc: Container for a physics representation of an object.

ConstraintBone1:
Name of first bone (body) that this constraint is connecting.
This will be the 'child' bone in a PhysicsAsset.
ConstraintBone2:
Name of second bone (body) that this constraint is connecting.
This will be the 'parent' bone in a PhysicsAset.
Pos1: Location of constraint in Body1 reference frame (usually the "child" body for skeletal meshes).
PriAxis1: Primary (twist) axis in Body1 reference frame.
SecAxis1: Secondary axis in Body1 reference frame. Orthogonal to PriAxis1.
Pos2: Location of constraint in Body2 reference frame (usually the "parent" body for skeletal meshes).
PriAxis2: Primary (twist) axis in Body2 reference frame.
SecAxis2: Secondary axis in Body2 reference frame. Orthogonal to PriAxis2.
AngularRotationOffset:
Specifies the angular offset between the two frames of reference. By default limit goes from (-Angle, +Angle)
This allows you to bias the limit for swing1 swing2 and twist.
ProfileInstance: Constraint Data (properties easily swapped at runtime based on different constraint profiles)
bScaleLinearLimits: If true, linear limits scale using the absolute min of the 3d scale of the owning component
